options.content: Higher temperatures the solubility of the phosphatides in the oil is decreased

options.label: B
options.content: Too much water can cause oil losses through hydrolysis

options.label: C
options.content: Too little water produces dark viscous gums and hazy oil

options.label: D
options.content: Lower temperatures the oil viscosity increases

content: Which one of not the advantage of oil seed dehulling. (4pts)

options.label: A
options.content: Reduce the total oil yield by absorbing or retaining oil in the pressed cake

options.label: B
options.content: Increases oil production efficiency, capacity of the extraction equipment and reduces wear in the expeller

options.label: C
options.content: Remove wax and color compounds present in the husk also entered to the extracted oil

From the following statements, which one is true?

options.label: A
options.content: Unit operations refer to the steps intended primarily to perform some physical/chemical transformation of the input streams

options.label: B
options.content: Drying operation is classified under mechanical operations

options.label: C
options.content: The mechanical operations are based on the change and differences in the physical properties of materials and don’t involve the study of the transport phenomena

content: Length of the line which bisects the particle image is.

The main type of mechanism or force applied in ultrafine grinders is.
In wet granulation, coalescence is.

options.label: A
options.content: The joining together of two or more granules (or a granule plus a primary particle) to form a larger granule

options.label: B
options.content: the initial process of combining primary solid particles with a liquid drop

options.label: C
options.content: the term used to describe the increase in granule density caused by closer packing of primary particles as liquid is squeezed out

options.label: D
options.content: fracture/breakage of a granule to form two or more pieces

content: In storage of bulk solids, which one is true?

options.label: A
options.content: Silos are taller and relatively small in diameter

options.label: B
options.content: Bins are wide with relatively short diameter

content: Which one of the following is true?

options.label: A
options.content: The total volume in the bed which is not occupied by the solid material is called porosity

options.label: C
options.content: In fluid flow through porous beds, the pressure drop for laminar flow is determined by Kozeny-Carman equation

content: One is not a criterion to be considered for the selection of oxygen scavenger for active packaging.

options.label: A
options.content: The nature of the food such as size, shape and weight

options.label: B
options.content: The moisture content and water activity

options.label: C
options.content: The amount oxygen dissolved in the product

Which of the following is true about fruits and vegetable processing?

options.label: A
options.content: They get spoiled very fast and hence need to be consumed soon

options.label: B
options.content: They have high moisture content and should be kept in a cold, dark place

options.label: C
options.content: They’re tender and hence get spoiled easily

content: Which of the following is not related to Post Harvest losses?

options.label: A
options.content: Post-harvest losses can be reduced by adding value to products

options.label: B
options.content: Packaging, storage, transportation areas are where losses take place

options.label: C
options.content: Farmers don’t earn much after adding value to products

options.label: D
options.content: Value can be added to products by converting raw form into a more processed/refined         form

content: Following are ways in which losses take place. Which of the following is untrue?

options.label: B
options.content: Inadequate methods of storage and transportation

options.label: C
options.content: Respiration in plants leads to drying, less sweetness, less valued product

content: Statement 1: The governing principle in jams and jellies is high acidity and high sugar content. Both these points are used to preserve them longer. Statement 2: Ginger is added sometimes to marmalade.
Statement 1: Jam cannot be made using pulp of more than one fruit. Statement 2: Acid and Pectin content is more in over-ripe fruits than in under-ripe fruits.
Concentrate of fruits and vegetable juices

options.label: A
options.content: Favor the growth of A. Niger and A. flavus species

options.label: B
options.content: Favor the growth of yeast and of acid and sugar tolerant Leuconostoc and Lactobacillus

options.label: D
options.content: Favor the growth of saprophytic bacteria
